Header.title: EzPark
Header.paragraph: Showcasing real-time availability of parking spots online for enhanced convenience and efficiency.

About.paragraph1: This product, a smart parking solution, uses cutting-edge technology to enhance the efficiency and convenience of parking management.
About.paragraph2: By utilising sensors, automatic number plate recognition, and real-time data analysis, this product is able to monitor the availability of parking spots in real-time and provide this information to users through online platforms or mobile applications.

Services.name: Hardware
Services.text: The system is created using a Raspberry Pi Zero W and sensors for rapid product development and deployment, and to keep costs down. The sensors used are: VL53LOx Time-of-Flight, PN532 RFID Reader, CCS811 Air Quality Sensor and a camera. The choice of hardware allows for easy expansion of the system to as many spaces as is required; simply adding more VL53L0x sensors and some small code modifications are needed.

Services.name: ANPR
Services.text: Automatic number plate recognition is run to identify vehicles in order to verify if access is permitted. Alternatively, if a card is used for entry, the number plate is read for the user to see in their history. The processing takes place on a server using machine learning algorithms with TensorFlow for plate detection and OCR (optical character recognition) to extract the plate number.

Services.name: Realtime Database
Services.text: A realtime NoSQL database hosted on Google Firebase is used to store and serve up-to-date information on space availability and type to the website. The database requires a private key for access and is accessed using HTTPS, ensuring security of user information which is stored to allow automatic entry and history lookup, showing times of entry and exit along with the number plate of the car.

Services.name: Environmental Sensors
Services.text: Temperature, humidity, CO2 levels and TVOC (Total Volatile Organic Compounds) are continuously monitored using I2C communication between the Raspberry Pi and sensors, and is displayed on the website to show air quality information.
